Kempegowda International Airport located in Devanahalli, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India is one of the third busiest airports in South India and quite a large one which is hi-tech as far as infrastructure, amenities, the number of flight arrivals and departures or the ease and availability of connections.  I have traveled multiple times through this airport while flying from overseas in 2012, 2015, 2017, even as recently in 2019, apart from couple of domestic flights which I took to Bengaluru recently.

The airport in itself is quite far away from the city, but close to Hebbal.  It's a risky business leaving to the airport from the city, especially if you have to catch a domestic flight, compared to an international flight where you have the leeway of reporting in 3 hours or a bit more earlier due to any imminent security requirements or demands.  This is mainly due to the outrageous traffic which leads to congestion and traffic jams, a daily story for Bengalureans.  You will reach the airport in almost two hours from the city, depending on the number of vehicles, in spite of all the flyovers built.

The airport has all the necessary and useful facilities ranging from leave your baggage, duty free shops, curios/handicrafts, plenty of eateries, inside and outside etc.  Remember having Ghee roast/Dosa and tea, apart from having pizza from one of the outlets in the International terminal in 2012.  It was very expensive, almost double the cost from what you pay outside.  It was not a good idea or not necessary before you board a flight to fly abroad.  In 2015, I tried 7 Tawas and just had regular tea, before departing, apart from 2017.  They had all kinds of foods and even alcohol or beer which I never tried.  Have tried Subway outside in 2015, besides recently which has always been a busy place.  However, they do offer very good fresh sandwiches which you could just carry on with you for a quick bite while inside the terminal/take home, far less expensive as well!  

Tried Hatti Kappi twice at the arrivals gate, recently while arriving in Bengaluru on two different domestic flights.  It's a pretty affordable place where you even have some combo options and all vegetarian, if I amn't mistaken, next to Pizza Hut.  This is among a few eat out options, before you catch your rides.  There are currently a whole lot new places already open and doing really well.  Relish on some pastries, cakes/ice cream, a filter coffee/tea.

This is a high security airport which I know from experience.  Customs frisked a necklace in 2012, which happened to be just personal effects and for the only reason, the item being gold and since we were flying out of Dubai.  It was just an inconvenience due to further delays to reach baggage retrieval.  

The airport has multiple lounges.  Tried the Plaza Premium lounge in 2015.  It's a very expensive place for a few hours, should say "couple" of hours.  The single room in itself is very crammed and not enough space for the money you spend.  They do offer a hot buffet, apart from some free magazines.

Kempegowda International offers BMTC buses to the city and even has a bus stand outside.  KSRTC offers luxury Flybus services not only to Mysuru, but also to Tirupathi, Coorg, Mangalore, Hyderabad and Salem etc.  It has chemical toilets inside and provides mineral water.  You can book tickets online, pay at the counter outside the airport or even pay cash inside, upon boarding.

Things which needs some improvements:

Immigration counters were very slow, shortly after midnight recently on an incoming flight from Paris.  It took more than half an hour to get it over.  

The bags arrival at the carousel recently were confusing and not correct which further delayed my time getting out.

The restrooms were pretty small and one was totally full after exiting a domestic flight recently.  Couple of incoming flights could make a huge difference!  

The seating area, once you enter the international departures, next to ticketing  could get really crowded with hardly any seats left during times of multiple departing flights.
